thread.title: Smoke detectors credited with saving family from overnight house fire
thread.title_full: Smoke detectors credited with saving family from overnight house fire

author: @wectnews
title: Smoke detectors credited with saving family from overnight house fire
text:
Smoke detectors credited with saving family from overnight house fire
NEW HANOVER COUNTY N.C. (WECT) - A family and their pets escaped from an overnight house fire on Oneida Lake Road in New Hanover County.
According to New Hanover Fire Rescue Battalion Chief Benjamin Bobzien, crews arrived shortly after midnight Thursday morning to a fire in the family’s garage.
“Occupants were alerted by smoke detectors, which really echoes the importance of having working smoke detectors in your home. It really contributed to keeping them safe,” Bobzien said.
Bobzien stressed the importance of checking smoke detectors twice a year.
“We definitely encourage everyone to check their smoke detectors and ensure they’re working properly,” said Bobzien. “Switch the batteries every 6 months usually around daylight saving.”
The cause of the house fire is under investigation.
